name: Javascript
description: A high-level, dynamic, untyped, and interpreted programming language.

name: Python
description: An interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language.

name: Java
description: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language.

name: C++
description: A general-purpose programming language created as an extension of the C programming language.

name: Ruby
description: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.

name: PHP
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development.

name: Swift
description: A powerful and intuitive programming language for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

name: Go
description: An open-source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

name: Kotlin
description: A modern programming language that makes developers happier.

name: Rust
description: A systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

name: HTML
description: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

name: CSS
description: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

name: SQL
description: A domain-specific language used in programming and managing relational databases.

name: R
description: A programming language and free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Dart
description: An open-source general-purpose programming language with a focus on client-side development.

name: TypeScript
description: A strict syntactical superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing.

name: Scala
description: A high-level programming language that combines functional and object-oriented programming.

name: Perl
description: A family of two high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages.

name: Shell
description: A command-line interpreter that provides a user interface for the Unix operating system.

name: MATLAB
description: A multi-paradigm numerical computing environment and proprietary programming language.

name: COBOL
description: A compiled English-like computer programming language designed for business use.

name: Fortran
description: A general-purpose, compiled imperative programming language that is especially suited to numeric computation.

name: Ada
description: A structured, statically typed, imperative, and object-oriented high-level computer programming language.

name: Lisp
description: A family of computer programming languages with a long history and a distinctive, fully parenthesized prefix notation.

name: Haskell
description: A standardized, general-purpose purely functional programming language with non-strict semantics.

name: Elixir
description: A dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications.

name: Clojure
description: A modern, functional, and dynamic dialect of the Lisp programming language.

name: Erlang
description: A general-purpose, concurrent, functional programming language.

name: F#
description: A functional-first programming language that also supports object-oriented and procedural programming.

name: OCaml
description: A general-purpose programming language with an emphasis on expressiveness and safety.

name: Assembly
description: A low-level programming language that is closely related to machine code.

name: Scratch
description: A visual programming language aimed primarily at children.

name: Logo
description: An educational programming language known for its use of turtle graphics.

name: Smalltalk
description: An object-oriented, dynamically typed reflective programming language.

name: Prolog
description: A logic programming language associated with artificial intelligence and computational linguistics.

name: Solidity
description: A contract-oriented programming language for writing smart contracts.

name: VHDL
description: A hardware description language used to model electronic systems.

name: Verilog
description: A hardware description language used to model electronic systems.

name: ABAP
description: A high-level programming language created by the German software company SAP SE.

name: ActionScript
description: An object-oriented programming language originally developed by Macromedia Inc. for use in Adobe Flash.

name: CoffeeScript
description: A programming language that transcompiles to JavaScript.

name: Crystal
description: A programming language with a syntax similar to Ruby but with static type checking.

name: Nim
description: A statically typed compiled systems programming language.

name: PureScript
description: A strongly-typed functional programming language inspired by Haskell.

name: Elm
description: A functional language for front-end web development.

name: OCaml
description: A general-purpose programming language with an emphasis on expressiveness and safety.

name: Hack
description: A programming language for HHVM that interoperates seamlessly with PHP.

name: Xojo
description: A cross-platform development tool and programming language.

name: Dylan
description: A multi-paradigm programming language that supports functional, object-oriented, and imperative programming.

name: Io
description: A prototype-based programming language with a small syntax.

name: Red
description: A high-level programming language that is designed to be easy to learn and use.

name: Factor
description: A concatenative programming language with a focus on functional programming.

name: XSLT
description: A language for transforming XML documents into other XML documents.

name: ANTLR
description: A powerful parser generator for reading, processing, executing, or translating structured text or binary files.

name: Sed
description: A Unix utility that parses and transforms text.

name: AWK
description: A programming language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool.

name: PostScript
description: A page description language used primarily in the electronic and desktop publishing areas.

name: Tcl
description: A dynamic programming language, commonly used for rapid prototyping, scripted applications, GUIs, and testing.

name: VBScript
description: A scripting language developed by Microsoft that is modeled on Visual Basic.

name: PowerShell
description: A task automation framework from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and associated scripting language.

name: Bash
description: A Unix shell and command language.

name: Zig
description: A general-purpose programming language and toolchain for maintaining robust, optimal, and reusable software.

name: Vala
description: A programming language that aims to bring modern programming features to GNOME.

name: NATURAL
description: A 4GL programming language used for business applications.

name: OpenCL
description: An open standard for parallel programming of heterogeneous systems.

name: OpenGL
description: A cross-language, cross-platform application programming interface for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics.

name: DirectX
description: A set of application programming interfaces for handling tasks related to multimedia.

name: CUDA
description: A parallel computing platform and application programming interface model created by NVIDIA.

name: Vulkan
description: A low-overhead, cross-platform API for high-performance, 3D graphics.

name: WebAssembly
description: A binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine.

name: XQuery
description: A functional query and functional programming language that is designed to query XML data.

name: SPARQL
description: An RDF query language and protocol.

name: GraphQL
description: A data query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries.

name: Cypher
description: A declarative graph query language for property graphs.

name: Datalog
description: A declarative logic programming language that syntactically is a subset of Prolog.

name: T-SQL
description: An extension of SQL that is used in Microsoft SQL Server.

name: PL/SQL
description: A procedural language extension for SQL.

name: XSL-FO
description: An XML-based language for formatting XML data.

name: YAML
description: A human-readable data serialization standard.

name: JSON
description: A lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write.

name: XML
description: A markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.

name: TOML
description: A data serialization language intended for configuration files.

name: INI
description: A simple, informal standard for configuration files for software applications.

name: CSV
description: A simple file format used to store tabular data, such as a spreadsheet or database.

name: Protocol Buffers
description: A method developed by Google for serializing structured data.

name: Thrift
description: An open-source software framework for scalable cross-language services development.

name: Avro
description: A framework for data serialization.

name: MessagePack
description: An efficient binary serialization format.

name: CBOR
description: Concise Binary Object Representation, a data format designed for small code size and small message size.

name: BSON
description: A binary representation of JSON-like documents.

name: FlatBuffers
description: An open-source serialization library.

name: Cap'n Proto
description: A data interchange format similar to Protocol Buffers.

name: FITS
description: A digital file format used for storing, transmitting, and manipulating scientific data.

name: HDF5
description: A set of file formats and libraries for storing and managing data.

name: NetCDF
description: A set of software libraries and machine-independent data formats for array-oriented scientific data.

name: Parquet
description: A columnar storage file format optimized for use with big data processing frameworks.

name: ORC
description: A columnar storage file format that is highly optimized for read-heavy workloads.

name: Avro
description: A data serialization system.

name: Iceberg
description: An open table format for huge analytic datasets.

name: Delta Lake
description: An open-source storage layer that brings ACID transactions to Apache Spark and big data workloads.
